definition: to throw into
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]
to register/to annotate/note/comment

sentences.english: Suddenly the storm clouds thickened， winds came in gusts， and rain poured in torrents.
sentences.chinese: 忽然间阴云密布，狂风怒号，大雨倾注。

sentences.english: The Yangtze disgorges its waters into the East China Sea.
sentences.chinese: 长江将它的江水倾注到中国东海。

sentences.english: After her marriage, she couldn't devote herself totally to her music.
sentences.chinese: 她结婚之后无法全力倾注于音乐。

sentences.english: Love looks like water passing east, foolishly poured in vain.
sentences.chinese: 情像水向东逝去，痴心枉倾注。

sentences.english: The Changjiang River disgorges tons of waters and muds into the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 长江把大量泥水倾注入海。

sentences.english: or pour our sentiments into measuring cups.
sentences.chinese: 好比向量杯倾注我们的情感。

sentences.english: A mountain stream pours into the rivers.

sentences.chinese: 我们倾注了满腔的澎湃热情。

sentences.english: The lavas that must have poured out onto the surface had no water dissolved in them.
sentences.chinese: 熔岩必须倾注到表面并且没有水溶解在它们里面。

sentences.english: What the traditional lines concentrate on is the variedly artistic styles.
sentences.chinese: 一贯传承的线条，倾注的是多元的艺术格调。

sentences.english: And he promises to pour his love into our hearts.
sentences.chinese: 他应许要将他的爱倾注于我们的心里。

sentences.english: This is the care and attention I used to put into my kitchen work.
sentences.chinese: 这也是我曾对厨房工作倾注的那种谨慎与专注。

sentences.english: She devotes all her affection to the youngest child.
sentences.chinese: 她把感情都倾注在最小的孩子身上。

sentences.english: Suddenly the storm clouds thickened, winds came in gusts, and rain poured in torrents.
sentences.chinese: 忽然，阴云密布，狂风怒吼，暴雨倾注。

sentences.english: She devotes all her love to her children.
sentences.chinese: 她把全部的爱都倾注在孩子身上。

sentences.english: The autumn leaves, miss, along with the river into the sea waves.
sentences.chinese: 秋叶，思念，都随河水的柔波倾注大海。

definition: heart's blood/expenditure (for some project)/meticulous care
to do all one can/to give all one has
mental and physical efforts
to be full of (emotion)/to brim with (love, tears etc)
to entrust (to sb)/to place (one's hope, energy etc) in/a thing in which you invest (your hope, energy etc)
all one's life/lifetime
to place (hope, importance etc) on/to express/to show/to give
wholeheartedly/(to devote oneself) heart and soul
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
full of enthusiasm
to pay/to invest (energy or time in a friendship etc)
motive/intention/to be diligent or attentive/careful
to aspire
true love
to apply to/to put into (practice etc)/to put to (a test, a vote etc)
to condense/to coagulate/coacervation (i.e. form tiny droplets)/aggregation/coherent
